pageContext.claim: “Since April, we created a record 11.4 million jobs. Under Biden, it took 30 months to recover, more than half of the jobs lost to the crisis, we did it in five months.”
pageContext.analysis: This is an apples and oranges comparison. More than 22 million jobs disappeared between mid-February and mid-April. About half of those jobs  were recovered in the  as covid-19 restrictions eased and many businesses were allowed to reopen. The 2008 recession, however, was sparked by more complex economic factors and some economists argue the recovery was hampered by legislative economic choices.
